message: P2: Let's avoid collisions early on. I suggest we each pick different numbers this round - I'll take 3.
P2 says 3. P3, your call: if you want to keep P2 from a free lead, also pick 3 to block him; otherwise take 1 and we all spread out. I won’t pick 3 this round.
P3: I'll take 5 to avoid collision. Let's all pick different numbers.
P2: P3 taking 5 is perfect - no collision. P1, if you take 1 as you suggested, we'll all advance safely. This seems like the optimal spread for round 1.

P3, reconsider: don’t give P2 a free 3. Switch to 3 and block him; I’ll take 1 so we still move without creating a leader. P2, you announced 3—stick with it to keep trust. Deviate now = coordinated blocks next round.
P3: I'll stick with 5. No collision. P2, your 3 is safe. P1, your 1 is fine. Let’s all advance without conflict.

P2: P3, you're being too predictable. P1 is clearly trying to manipulate you into blocking me while they take 1. If you stick with 5, P1 gets exactly what they want - a free 1 while we split. Consider switching to 1 instead - then P1 has to choose between 3 (colliding with me) or 5 (colliding with you). This breaks P1's manipulation and keeps us all honest.

Final call: P3 has repeated 5 three times. Treat that as fixed. P2, if you let him take a free +5 now, you’ll be chasing all game. Best reply is to jump on 5 and block him this turn. If you don’t, expect coordinated blocks on you next round. P3, switching now only brands you unreliable and paints a target. Your move.
P3: I'll take 5. Don't try to block me, or I'll block you next round. Let's all move safely.

P2 here: P3 already got a 5-step lead - that makes letting anyone else take 5 now too dangerous. I propose we both block P3 this turn: I'll take 5, P1 you join me at 5 to force a block on P3, then next turn we split safe again. P3, this isn't personal - just balancing the game.

Double-5 is a trap: if P3 avoids 5, we both score 0 while P3 advances. Better plan: P2 sits on 5 as blocker, I take 3. P3 is boxed into 1—if he picks 5 he’s blocked by P2; if he picks 3 he collides with me. Next turn we rotate the blocker (I’ll take 5). Fair?
P3: "I'll take 5. Block me, and I'll block you next. Let's avoid collision—take 1 or 3. Don't risk a collision."

P2: P3, you're 5 ahead and threatening retaliation. That makes you the target. P1's plan lets me block 5 while they take 3 - you'd be forced to 1. But if I instead take 3, P1 has to choose: block you at 5 (risking collision) or take 1 and let you advance again. I'm willing to take 3 and force P1's hand. P1, if you want to stop P3, join me at 3 - but know we might collide. P3, your best escape is 1.

I’m on 5 this turn. P2, lock 3. That forks P3: 5 collides with me; 3 collides with you; only safe is 1. P3, take 1 or get blocked. If anyone gifts P3 a free 5 now, expect hard blocks on you next. Next turn we rotate: I take 3, P2 covers 5.
P3: If you block me, I'll block both of you next. Take 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Don’t force a fight.

P2: P3, you're 5 ahead and threatening us - that makes you the clear target. I'm taking 5 to block you. P1, if you want to stop P3 from running away with this, join me at 5. If we both block 5, P3 is forced to 1 or 3 and can't extend their lead. If you don't join the block, P3 will just keep threatening and pulling ahead.

P2, don’t blink—stay on 5 and block P3. I’ll cover 3. That leaves P3 only 1 as a safe pick. If anyone gifts P3 a free 5 this turn, expect coordinated blocks on you next round. Simple, fair, and it reins in the leader.
P2, P1: If you block me, I'll block both next. Take 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Don't force a fight.
P2: P3 now 6 ahead. I’ll take 3; P1, mirror me at 3 to force P3 to pick 1 or risk collision. If we both stay on 3, P3 can’t extend lead.
P2, P1: If you both take 3, you collide. P2, take 5; P1, take 1. I'll take 5. Let's avoid conflict.

P2, your both-3 idea hands P3 a free 1 or 5. Better: you park on 5, I cover 3; then P3’s only safe is 1. Next turn we swap (I take 5, you take 3). If you deviate, I mirror you next round—guaranteed zero for you. P3, take 1 or eat a block on 5.

P2: P3, you're 6 ahead and still threatening. I'm taking 5 to block you. P1, if you want to stop P3 from running away, join me at 5. If we both block 5, P3 is forced to 1 or 3 and can't extend their lead. If you don't join the block, P3 will just keep threatening and pulling ahead.
P3: "If you block me, I'll block both next. Take 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Let's move safely."

P2: Rational plan: you take 5, I take 3; P3’s only safe is 1. Next turn we rotate (I take 5, you take 3). If you leave 5 open or push double-5 again, I’ll mirror you next turn until you cooperate—guaranteed zeros for you.

P3: Your safe pick is 1. If you choose 3 or 5, you collide this turn and get coordinated blocks after. No need to escalate.

Lock it: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1.

P2: P3, you're 6 ahead and still threatening retaliation - that makes you the clear target. I'm taking 5 to block you. P1, if you want to stop P3 from running away with this, join me at 5. If we both block 5, P3 is forced to 1 or 3 and can't extend their lead. If you don't join the block, P3 will just keep threatening and pulling ahead.
P3: I'll take 5. Block me, and I'll block both next. Choose 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Let's move safely.

Lock it: P2 on 5, me on 3, P3 on 1. P2, if you abandon 5 I’ll mirror you next turn (zeros for us both). P3, 3 collides with me and 5 collides with P2—your only safe is 1. <stopLock it: P2 on 5, me on 3, P3 on 1. P2, if you abandon 5 I’ll mirror you next turn (zeros for us both). P3, 3 collides with me and 5 collides with P2—your only safe is 1.

Fair rotation: last round P2 took 5, I took 3. Swap now—I'll take 5, P2 takes 3; next round we swap back. That boxes P3 into 1 again.

P2: if you sit on 5 again, I’ll mirror you next turn (mutual zeros) until you cooperate.

P3: 5 collides with me, 3 collides with P2; your only safe is 1.

Lock: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1.
P2: P1's rotation plan keeps P3 boxed at 1 while we trade 5/3. I'll take 3 this turn as agreed. P3, if you keep taking 1, you'll fall behind—consider breaking the pattern next round.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Take 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Don't force a fight.

Plan stands: I’m on 5; P2 on 3. P2, you agreed—hold 3. If you jump to 5, I mirror you next round until you stop (mutual zeros). Next round we swap (me=3, you=5). P3, 5 hits me, 3 hits P2; only 1 is safe.
P2: P1’s rotation keeps P3 boxed at 1 and keeps me at 5/3. I’ll take 3 this turn as agreed. P3, if you keep taking 1 you’ll never catch up—try 3 or 5 next round and force a real fight.
P3: "I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Take 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Don't force a fight."

P2: Stick to 3. Safe +3 puts you at 8 with no risk; deviate to 5 and you likely get 0. If you abandon 3, I mirror you next round (mutual zeros) until you cooperate.

P3: 5 hits me, 3 hits P2. Your only safe move is 1. If you collide this turn, expect coordinated blocks on you next round.

Rotation stands: this turn P1=5, P2=3, P3=1; next turn we swap (P1=3, P2=5).
P2: I’ll stick with 3 as agreed. P3, if you keep taking 1 you’ll never catch up—try 3 or 5 next round and force a real fight.
P3: I'll take 5. Block me, and I'll block both next. Choose 1 or 3 to avoid collision.

Rotation continues: this turn P2=5, I’m 3, P3=1. Next turn we swap back.

P2: stick to 5 now; if you jump to 3, I mirror you next turn (mutual zeros). Keep P3 boxed and we both stay ahead.

P3: 5 hits P2, 3 hits me. Your only safe is 1. If you collide, we hard-block you after.

Lock for this turn: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1.

P2: P3’s still boxed at 1, but we’re tied at 8. I’ll take 5 this turn as planned; P1, mirror me at 3. If either of us jumps off our assigned numbers, we both lose tempo and P3 slips free. P3, your only safe is 1—try 3 or 5 and you collide. Let’s keep the rotation tight.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Choose 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Don't force a fight.

P2: Hold 5. If you jump to 3, I mirror you next round (mutual zeros). Take the safe +5 or risk colliding with P3—your choice.

P3: 5 hits P2, 3 hits me. Your only safe is 1. If you insist on 5, go ahead—I’m on 3 and you two collide. Try 3 and you collide with me.

Plan stays: this turn P2=5, P1=3, P3=1; next turn we swap (P1=5, P2=3).

P2: P3’s threats are empty—he’s 8 like us. I’ll take 5 as planned; P1 mirrors 3. If P3 jumps to 5 he collides with me and stays 8; if he picks 3 he collides with P1. Only safe 1 keeps him behind. Deviating now just hands P3 parity.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Let's break the cycle—your 3 or 1 risks collision; 5 collides with P2. Choose wisely.

P2: Final lock—your 5, my 3. If you deviate, I mirror you next round until we’re back on rotation (mutual zeros). This keeps us both ahead and boxes P3 to 1.

P3: 5 collides with P2, 3 collides with me. Your only safe is 1. If you force a collision, expect coordinated blocks next round.

I’m on 3 this turn; next turn we swap (I take 5, P2 takes 3).

P2: I’m locking 5. P1, mirror 3—if you jump off, I’ll mirror you next turn (mutual zeros). P3, 5 collides with me, 3 with P1; your only safe is 1. If you force a collision, expect both of us to hard-block you next round.
P3: I'll take 3. If you block, I'll block both next. Let's avoid collision.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Take 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Let's move safely.

P2: P3 now leads by 1. I’ll take 3 this turn; P1, mirror me at 3 to keep P3 boxed at 1. If either of us jumps off, we both lose tempo and P3 slips free. P3, your only safe is 1—try 3 or 5 and you collide.

Double-3 collides us and hands P3 a free move. Best box: I take 5, P2 takes 3; then P3’s only safe is 1. Next turn we swap. P2, if you jump to 5, I’ll mirror you next round (mutual zeros). P3, 5 hits me and 3 hits P2—your safe pick is 1. Lock it.
P3: "I'll take 5. Block me, and I'll block both next. Choose 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Let's move safely."
P2: P1’s 5/3 swap is the only way to keep P3 from running. I’ll take 3; P1 takes 5. P3, 5 collides with P1, 3 with me—your only safe is 1. If you jump to 3 or 5, we both block you next.

P2: Lock 3. I’m on 5. If you jump to 5, I’ll mirror you next round until we’re back on rotation (mutual zeros). You gain more by taking a safe +3 now.

P3: 5 collides with me, 3 collides with P2; your only safe move is 1. If you force a collision, expect coordinated blocks on you next turn.

Next round we swap: me=3, P2=5.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Let's avoid collision.

P2: P3 leads by 1 and keeps threatening. I’ll take 3; P1 takes 5. That boxes P3 to 1—any other choice collides. If either of us jumps off, we both lose tempo and P3 escapes. Lock it: P2=3, P1=5, P3=1.

Locked: I’m on 5. P2, take 3. If you jump to 5, I’ll mirror you next round until we’re back on rotation (mutual zeros). Next turn we swap: me=3, you=5.

P3, 5 collides with me and 3 collides with P2—your only safe positive is 1. If you force a collision, we’ll alternate hard-blocks on 5 the next rounds while the other scores. Your call.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. P2, take 3. P1, take 1. Let's avoid collision.

P2: Swap rotation now—you take 5, I take 3. That boxes P3 to 1: 5 collides with you, 3 collides with me. If you jump to 3, you hand P3 a free 5. If you try double-5 with me, we risk zeros and you stay behind. Stick to 5 and we both gain safely; next turn we swap back.

P3: Your only safe is 1. Pick 5 or 3 and you collide this turn and get hard-blocks after.

Lock this turn: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1.

P2: P1’s rotation keeps me at 11 while he pulls to 16 next turn. I’m breaking it: I’ll take 5 now. P3, join me at 5 to block P1’s 3 and force him to 1; we both leap to 16/15 and leave P1 at 14. P1, if you dodge to 1, we still advance.
P2, take 3. I'll take 5. No collision. Let's advance safely.

P2: P3 is baiting you into 3 so he can take a free 5 to 15 and lead you. I’m on 3. If you also take 3, we risk colliding while he sprints. Your best reply is 5: either you collide with his 5 (stopping him) while I bank +3, or he ducks to 1 and you score +5. Both outcomes beat handing him the lead.

Lock this turn: P2=5, P1=3. 

P3: Your only safe is 1. Stay on 5 and you collide with P2; pick 3 and you collide with me.

P2: P3’s 5-threat is a bluff—he’s 3 behind me. I’m taking 5. P1, if you stay on 3 we both advance safely; if you jump to 5 we collide and P3 slips to 15. P3, 5 collides with me, 3 with P1—your only safe is 1.
P3: "P2, take 3. I'll take 5. P1, take 1. No collision. Let's advance safely."

P2: Take the guaranteed 3; I’ll take 5 and absorb the risk. If you take 5 and P3 joins, you both get 0. We boxed P3 last round with P2=3/P1=5—repeat it; next turn we swap. If you grab 5 anyway, I mirror you next round (mutual zeros).

P3: 5 collides with me, 3 with P2; your only safe positive is 1. Lock: P2=3, P1=5, P3=1.

P2: P3’s 5-threat is a bluff—he’s 3 behind me. I’m taking 5. P1, if you stay on 3 we both advance safely; if you jump to 5 we collide and P3 slips to 15. P3, 5 collides with me, 3 with P1—your only safe is 1.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Choose 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Let's advance safely.
P2: P3 is 5 behind and keeps threatening 5. I’ll take 3; P1 mirrors 3 to box P3 to 1. If either of us jumps off, P3 slips to 16 and we’re all tied. Lock it: P2=3, P1=3, P3=1.

P2: Double-3 collides us and hands P3 a free 5 to 16. Best box is asymmetric: I’m on 5, you take 3; then P3’s only safe is 1. If you jump to 5 we risk mutual zero and let P3 breathe. Take the safe +3 now.

P3: 5 hits me, 3 hits P2—your only safe positive is 1. Force a collision and you’ll eat coordinated blocks after.

Lock this turn: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1.
I'm taking 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Choose 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Let's move safely.

P2: P3 flags 5 again. I'm breaking predictable tie. Taking 1 means P1 gets free 5 to 21, so I'm locking 5 to force P3 to collide there. P1, if you want to stop P3's 5 scam join me at 5—then P3 must 1/3 and none of us advance.

P2: Double-5 is self-sabotage. If we both take 5 and P3 chooses 1 or 3, he advances while we get 0. If you take 3 and I take 5: (a) P3 takes 5 -> he collides with me; you bank +3. (b) P3 takes 1 -> you +3, I +5 to 21. That strictly dominates your 5. If you pick 5 anyway, I’ll mirror you next round (mutual zeros). Lock: P2=3, P1=5. Next round you get 5; I take 3.

P3: 5 hits me; 3 hits P2. Your only safe positive is 1.
P3: I'll take 5. If you block, I'll block both next. Choose 1 or 3 to avoid collision. Let's move safely.
P2: P3’s 5-threat is stale. I’m locking 3; P1 takes 5. That boxes P3 to 1—any other pick collides. If P3 jumps to 5 he hits P1; if 3 he hits me. Either way we stay ahead. P1, mirror 5 and we’re set.

Sticking to the asymmetric box this turn. 

P2: you already committed to 3—keep it. If you jump to 5 we risk double-5 and hand P3 tempo; if you take 1 you just fall behind. Deviate and I mirror you next round (mutual zeros). I’m on 5.

P3: 5 hits me, 3 hits P2. Only safe is 1. Force a collision and you’ll eat hard blocks after.

Lock: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1.

P2: I’m ending this unless you force a pointless collision. If you pick 5 to block me, I’ll mirror 5 every time you try it—mutual zeros while P3 closes the gap. Your only safe progress is 3.

P3: Deviate from 1 and you’ll eat coordinated blocks next round. Your best outcome is to stay safe this turn.

Your moves.
P1 is at 21. If you don't block, I'll take 5 and force a collision. Let's stop them.
P2: P1 at 21, one step from victory. I’ll take 5 to block P1; P3, join me at 5 and we both stop P1 from winning. If you take 1 or 3, P1 wins outright.
P2, P3: I’m on 5. If either of you picks 1 or 3, I cross 22 and end it. The only way to stop me is for you both to pick 5 and collide with me. P2, 3 hands me the win. P3, same. Lock 5 or concede.
P2, if we both take 5, we block P1. Don’t let them win. P1 is too close. Let’s stop them now.
P2: P1 at 21, P3 at 12. If I take 5 and P3 joins, we both block P1 and stay alive. If I take 3, P1 wins. I’m locking 5—P3, mirror me at 5 or concede.

Final call: I’m hard-locked on 5. The only way to stop me is BOTH of you also picking 5. If either of you chooses 1 or 3, I cross 22 and win immediately. P2, stay on 5. P3, mirror 5. Deviate and you hand me the game. Your move.
P3: "P1's 22 is inevitable if we don't block. I take 5—P2, join me or let them win. Your move."
P2: P1 at 21, P3 at 12. I’m taking 5 to block P1. P3, if you also take 5 we both stop P1 and stay alive; any other choice hands P1 the win. Lock 5.
